short_desc: Heart attack caused by blocked coronary artery presenting with chest pain crushing pressure left arm pain jaw pain shortness of breath sweating nausea
Chest pain or pressure caused by reduced blood flow to heart muscle often triggered by exertion or stress relieved by rest
Severely elevated blood pressure causing headache vision changes chest pain shortness of breath confusion nausea
Condition where heart cannot pump enough blood causing shortness of breath fatigue leg swelling fluid retention reduced exercise tolerance
Irregular rapid heart rhythm causing palpitations dizziness shortness of breath fatigue chest discomfort fainting
Blood clot in deep vein usually leg causing swelling pain redness warmth tenderness calf pain
Blood clot in lung causing sudden shortness of breath chest pain rapid heart rate coughing blood dizziness fainting
Brain cell death due to blocked blood vessel causing sudden facial drooping arm weakness slurred speech vision loss severe headache
Temporary stroke-like episode with brief numbness weakness vision changes slurred speech resolving within 24 hours
Recurrent severe headache often one-sided with nausea vomiting light sensitivity sound sensitivity visual aura lasting hours to days
Bilateral pressing tightening headache mild to moderate intensity not worsened by activity no nausea
Severe one-sided headache around eye with tearing nasal congestion restlessness occurring in clusters
Recurrent seizures with convulsions loss of consciousness confusion staring spells muscle jerking
Demyelinating disease causing fatigue vision problems numbness tingling weakness coordination problems bladder dysfunction
Progressive movement disorder with tremor rigidity bradykinesia postural instability shuffling gait masked face
Chronic metabolic disorder with high blood sugar causing increased thirst frequent urination fatigue blurred vision slow healing wounds
Autoimmune destruction of insulin-producing cells causing weight loss excessive thirst urination fatigue ketoacidosis
Underactive thyroid causing fatigue weight gain cold intolerance constipation dry skin hair loss depression slow heart rate
Overactive thyroid causing weight loss rapid heartbeat heat intolerance sweating anxiety tremor diarrhea
Excess cortisol causing weight gain moon face buffalo hump stretch marks high blood pressure muscle weakness

Low B12 causing fatigue weakness numbness tingling balance problems memory issues depression glossitis
Acid reflux causing heartburn chest burning regurgitation sour taste hoarseness chronic cough worse lying down
Stomach or duodenal ulcer causing burning epigastric pain nausea bloating worse with food or empty stomach
Functional bowel disorder with abdominal cramping bloating altered bowel habits diarrhea constipation relieved by defecation
Inflammatory bowel disease causing abdominal pain diarrhea weight loss fatigue rectal bleeding fever mouth sores
Inflammatory bowel disease causing bloody diarrhea abdominal cramping urgency rectal pain weight loss fatigue
Inflamed appendix causing periumbilical pain migrating to right lower quadrant nausea vomiting fever rebound tenderness
Inflamed gallbladder causing right upper quadrant pain after fatty meals nausea vomiting fever jaundice
Inflamed pancreas causing severe epigastric pain radiating to back nausea vomiting fever elevated lipase amylase
Chronic airway inflammation causing recurrent wheezing shortness of breath chest tightness cough worse at night exercise triggered
Progressive lung disease causing chronic cough sputum production shortness of breath wheezing barrel chest
Lung infection causing fever cough sputum production shortness of breath chest pain fatigue
Mycobacterial lung infection causing chronic cough hemoptysis night sweats weight loss fever fatigue
Bladder infection causing burning urination frequency urgency cloudy urine pelvic pain low grade fever
Renal calculi causing severe flank pain radiating to groin nausea vomiting blood in urine urinary urgency
Progressive kidney failure causing fatigue edema decreased urine output nausea hypertension anemia
Autoimmune joint disease causing symmetric joint pain swelling morning stiffness fatigue fever rheumatoid nodules
Degenerative joint disease causing joint pain stiffness worse with activity crepitus bony enlargement typically knees hips hands
Autoimmune disease causing butterfly rash joint pain fatigue fever photosensitivity kidney problems serositis
Uric acid crystal deposition causing sudden severe joint pain swelling redness warmth typically big toe

Low bone density causing back pain height loss fractures from minor trauma stooped posture

Excessive worry nervousness restlessness fatigue concentration difficulty irritability muscle tension sleep disturbance

Psychotic disorder with hallucinations delusions disorganized thinking negative symptoms social withdrawal

Dangerously high body temperature confusion hot dry skin rapid pulse loss of consciousness organ failure
